title: How to Play the Bilge Puzzle in Puzzle Pirates

steps.headline: Learn the aim of the game.
steps.description: In Puzzle Pirates, bilging is a ship puzzle that is a main part of speeding up the ship by draining it of water along with sailing. The puzzle consists of a board with, when you first start off as an amateur bilger, five different-colored tiles. As you become better and better, the puzzle will grow to six different colors, and eventually, it'll reach seven.

steps.headline: Get to know the controls.
steps.description: The controls for bilging are very simple; you are given a two-tile swap range, which can be controlled by either your mouse or arrow keys. To swap the two tiles selected, simply click the mouse button or use the spacebar. This sounds easy, but you can only swap two horizontal tiles; you can't swap vertically! This is what makes bilging in Puzzle Pirates quite a challenge.

steps.headline: Try to match tiles.
steps.description: In general, you must match at least three of the same tiles to clear it off the board. The match can be either vertical or horizontal, but not diagonal. You can also match four or five in a row for small bonuses.

steps.headline: Use combos to your advantage.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Know how animals in the bilge puzzle work.
steps.description: There are a total of three animals that come up in the bilge puzzle: the pufferfish, crab, and jellyfish. When you first play the puzzle as a newbie, animals will not come up at all. As you become better and bilge more often, these three animals will eventually all appear while you do your job.

steps.headline: Use the pufferfish to your advantage.
steps.description: The pufferfish is the first animal you'll see in the bilge puzzle. It'll start off small, only taking up one tile, but if you click on it, it will blow up and clear all surrounding tiles, meaning a total of nine tiles will be destroyed, eight if you don't include the pufferfish itself. This can be very helpful if you're in a pickle or are looking to make some combos!

steps.headline: Beware of the crab.
steps.description: The crab will come up taking the space of one tile, but any tiles you try to swap that include the crab won't be able to swap. In order to get rid of the crab, you have to clear tiles that are vertically aligned with it until it rises above the water line. It'll then exit the board, and you'll get some extra points in the meantime!

steps.headline: Try to get jellyfish.
steps.description: The jellyfish is very good to get; if you swap it with any nearby tiles, it'll clear all tiles of that type! After you use the jellyfish's special ability, it's good to search the board for some combos to rack up even more points.

steps.headline: Look out for maneuver pieces.
steps.description: If you continue to play the bilge puzzle often and do a good job, you'll eventually see maneuver pieces popping up on the board. These will appear as half-circles on some of the tiles that come up. When you match these, you will help the ship earn a maneuver, which "allows it to perform extraordinary feats". To work up to earning a maneuver, simply match the pieces to form full circles.

steps.headline: Keep your eyes open for when you should try matching maneuver pieces.
steps.description: If the captain of a ship is requesting a maneuver, a small maneuver indicator will show up on the right side of your screen (the side without the puzzle). There will also be a progress bar to how close you are to earning a maneuver. You can always match maneuver pieces, even if one isn't being requested at the moment.

parts.name: Learning What to Do and What Not to Do

steps.headline: Learn extra ways to earn points.
steps.description: If you're looking to become the ultimate bilger, racking up tons of points is the way to go. One of the best ways to earn points is by making lots of combos in only a little bit of moves. Look carefully for combos or even many tiles lined up in a row that will allow you to match four of five tiles at once rather than three. The best kinds of combos you can get are the ones that include a row of five! Clear crabs for even more points. If you have a lot of crabs on your board, look at it as a good thing by clearing them all out for an even better performance! Match maneuver pieces when possible.

steps.headline: Make sure you don't make a lot of moves.
steps.description: This will put a large penalty on your performance, even if you end up matching a combo or long line of tiles in the end. Instead of swapping several times to match five in a row, just stick to matching several three-in-a-rows.
